intro: Elatostema monandrum var. pedunculosum, commonly known as the slender-stalked bladderwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its short, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant is notable for its unique floral structure, featuring a single, showy flower with a two-lipped corolla. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on carnivorous plant adaptations.
